message.explainer: After logging in, you can browse through the folders on my computer. Go to the desktop and click on the projects folder to see all my projects.

contact.title: Contact me
contact.name: @:common.name
contact.description: If you'd like to talk about a project, or just have a chat, leave me a message and I'll get back to you as soon as possible!

logma.contextFirstParagraph: Logma production is a movie production company based in Rennes. Founded by Baptiste Fablet. At the start of this project, there was already a logma production site created by the company director with Wordpress.
logma.contextSecondParagraph: The decision was made to rebuild this site from scratch, with a simple, tried-and-tested technical stack, to try and make a website without a Framework and without someoneonce helping to make it fast and efficient.
logma.contextThirdParagraph: In order to make the entrepreneur autonomous in the management of this site, it was necessary to develop a backoffice from which he could publish new photos, add projects and links to his videos.
logma.goalFirst: Redesign of website with existing graphic identity
logma.goalThird: Develop a backoffice to manage the site
logma.goalFifth: Improve loading speed and overall performance

pangaia.contextFirstParagraph: Pangaia is an open-source application designed to raise awareness of plants.
pangaia.contextSecondParagraph: The aim was to create a fun and practical interface for managing your garden.
pangaia.contextThirdParagraph: But also to discover new plants using gamification.
pangaia.contextFourthParagraph: Provide information on the flora around us, depending on the user's location.
pangaia.goalFirst: Try out the application in demo mode
pangaia.goalFourth: Add a plant to your garden
pangaia.goalFifth: Connect to the weather in real time
pangaia.goalSixth: Reminders for tasks to be carried out on your plant or in your garden
pangaia.tasksDoneFirst: Help with database design and modeling
pangaia.tasksDoneThird: Work on UX with usability tests
pangaia.tasksDoneFifth: Creation of a page listing plants and categories
pangaia.tasksDoneSixth: Setting up an API and documentation with Swagger
pangaia.CDMText: Partial conceptual modeling of the database, concerning changes to be made to the project.

clench.contextFirstParagraph: An exercise as part of a CSS Framework & Layout course at MyDigitalSchool Rennes.
clench.contextSecondParagraph: The aim was to create the graphic interface of a web application in a week. No backend, but all graphic design.
clench.contextThirdParagraph: A campus-themed website, to create a fictitious medium on which the student union could communicate.
clench.contextFourthParagraph: With the help of Baptiste Marie, also a student, we created the graphic identity and build the website.
clench.goalFirst: Design a website and a wireframe based on customer's specifications
clench.goalThird: Develop the front end of the application using a CSS Framework

homeserver.contextFirstParagraph: This project was carried out by Pierre, who owns a video production company, and me, a web developer.
homeserver.contextSecondParagraph: A team you wouldn't necessarily count on to set up a server, I agree. But we share a common passion. Digging into subjects we know nothing about and trying to understand how a server works and how to set it up.
homeserver.goalFirst: Make a storage server that can also deploy applications
homeserver.goalSecond: Being able to access the server from anywhere
homeserver.goalThird: It is possible to edit a video project on remote
homeserver.goalFourth: Install automation services such as Jenkins, Sonarqube, etc.
homeserver.goalFifth: Have online website monitoring and alerts in case of loss of services
homeserver.goalSixth: Host pre-production sites before putting them online
homeserver.goalSeventh: Redundancy in data and remote access to it
homeserver.goalNinth: Be less expensive than a pre-assembled equivalent with the same performance
